channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Did Target’s CEO miss the mark by ignoring Minnesota?
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: What happened at Davos was a warning to CEOs: their companies are designed for a world that no longer exists
item.description: When allies hedge, CEOs must decide.

item.title: Palestinians Return to Gaza for First Time in Nearly Two Years
item.description: The returnees reunited with families but also said their homecomings carried symbolic weight — defying any schemes to permanently displace Gazans.

item.title: AI is changing the CEO’s role—and could lead to a changing of the guard
item.description: Even seasoned CEOs must show they can match the speed of technological change—and generate tangible returns from investments in it.

item.title: A Hamas Hostage’s Secret Ordeal
item.description: Guy Gilboa-Dalal says he was sexually abused by one of his captors in the tunnels of Gaza and threatened with death if he said anything.

item.title: Trump, in an Escalation, Calls for Republicans to ‘Nationalize’ Elections
item.description: The comments, made on a conservative podcast, follow a string of moves from his administration to try to exert more control over American elections.

item.title: Trump Says Republicans Should ‘Take Over’ Elections, and Clintons Agree to Testify in Epstein Inquiry
item.description: Plus, a conservative group plans an alternate Super Bowl halftime show.

item.title: Moltbook, the viral social media site for AI bots, contains a ‘lethal trifecta’ for how the agent internet could fail, security researchers say
item.description: “If toy agents on a Reddit clone can create this much chaos, what happens when agentic systems manage enterprise infrastructure or financial transacti...

item.title: Why President Trump’s latest crypto scandal could spell disaster for the blockchain industry
item.description: A bombshell report revealed that an Abu Dhabi royal bought a 49% stake in Trump’s flagship crypto project.

item.title: Democrats Call on ICE Watchdog to Speed Up Use of Force Inquiry
item.description: The inspector general for the Department of Homeland Security is scrutinizing use of force by ICE, according to Democrats in Congress who requested th...

item.title: First Vehicles Cross Reopened Gaza Border
item.description: The Rafah border crossing between Gaza and Egypt reopened Monday after having been largely closed since May 2024. It allowed some Gazans who had fled ...

item.title: Iran’s President Backs ‘Fair’ Talks With U.S. as Confrontation Looms
item.description: President Masoud Pezeshkian said on Tuesday that he supported “equitable negotiations.” Talks are expected on Friday, as diplomats work to defuse the ...

item.title: Trump and India Call Off Their Trade War, but the Terms of Peace Are Murky
item.description: Officials and business leaders sighed with relief at lower tariffs, as they wait to see what the rest of it means.

item.title: A Hamas Hostage’s Secret Ordeal
item.description: Guy Gilboa-Dalal says he was sexually abused by one of his captors in the tunnels of Gaza and threatened with death if he said anything.

item.title: Palestinians Return to Gaza for First Time in Nearly Two Years
item.description: The returnees reunited with families but also said their homecomings carried symbolic weight — defying any schemes to permanently displace Gazans.
